nodes.text: A pile of apple cores... Guess the thief decided to eat his lunch here... or supper... or midnight snack.

options.text: Examine the Pile of Apple Cores

nodes.text: There's a tacky mess in front of the fire place from all the apples eaten.
The apple cores here weren't just tossed aside, they were laid in this pile as though the thief sat in front of the fire while he ate the apples.
I can see one sticky track here that looks like a bird's foot. It's still slightly wet, so it must have been made just a short while ago.
There's a lot of blue hair stuck to the floor - looks like the thief has been here before tonight.
I'm tired. It's late. What's the point of looking for clues?
It's not my fault if the Rogue class gets canceled. I'm not the one who came here to be a hero. Let someone else save the Disbarred Bards.

options.text: Set a Trap near the Pile of Apple Cores
Place an Apple Near the Pile

nodes.text: If I put down an apple here, maybe I can lure the thief over to the fireplace.
This floor is so tacky, the thief will never see a pool of Gooey over it.
<yawn> Well, time to go hide and hope that I don't fall asleep.
This looks like a great place to set a trap for the thief.
<yawn> Well, time to go hide and hope that I don't fall asleep.
On second thought...
<yawn> I must have dozed off. Wonder what woke me up?
Hey! An apple! Yes!
Guess I must have dropped it earlier. What do you know - it's my lucky night.
Drat... I should clean up the apple mess before anyone finds it...
Damn, this would be the perfect place to set a trap to catch the thief. Why didn't I buy one when I had the chance?
Why do I feel like I've missed my chance somehow?
Oh well... It's getting late. I should probably turn in.
I'd better not move the cores if I want to try to catch the thief. I'll leave that to the clean-up staff.

options.text: Sense Magic on the Apple Cores

nodes.text: Not a sniff!
Of magic, I mean. There's plenty of other smells around it.
Yucky! What's this stuff? I'm stuck.
Oh my... what if this stuff gets in my fur? I'll never get it out.
Or worse? I get stuck here to the floor to wither away to a frail pile of fur and swept away like a dust bunny.
Cut down in the prime of my life. I, the best Finder of the Castle Kwirk - Lost. <sniff>
Hi there, you look like you could use some help.
Ack! Um.. don't mind me, I'm just resting here for a moment. You can go away and do human stuff now. I'm good.
You don't look so good right now. You look a bit stuck.
Stuck? Nah... I'll be fine... Just.. warming myself in front of the fireplace - that's it! Nothing wrong here at all.
So, you're the one who's been going around stealing things from this castle.
What? How... You mean, you've been here all this time? You could have warned me this place was sticky.
And what do you mean, stealing? I don't steal anything, I find things. I'm the numero uno, best in class Finder in my whole tribe.
You've been taking things from throughout this castle, and that makes you a thief.
Well, if you're going to be mean about it... I only borrow a few worthless odds and ends here and there. It's not like anyone will really miss them.
So what do we have here? Why, it looks like I caught the School Thief!
Yikes! What? How did you get here?
Wait... you mean this sticky stuff is a trap? You put this here to catch a thief?
Who you calling a thief?
I'm a Finder. I'm the number one Finder for my tribe for three months running... and I've done a lot of running for those three months, let me tell you.
They'll mourn me, now that I'm gone. They'll say that I was the best of the best, bar none.
They'll make a statue of fur in my honor, and name baby Kwirks after me.
They might even hold a contest every year, the Kinder Finder Reminder to award the up and coming young Finders in my honor. I'll be remembered fondly by everyone.
Wait... what's that? You! You there hiding behind the fireplace! You're spoiling my eulogy.
So what do you want?
I'll be happy to help you get unstuck. In return, I just need you to return everything you've stolen from the school to its rightful place.
What? That's highway robbery!
I'm not really stuck here. I'm just resting my feet. I don't need your help.
Please, you have to return the stuff you've taken from the school. The Headmaster is furious. He might close down the university if he doesn't get his hat back.
Close down the school? No, he can't do that! This has been the best thing that's ever happen to us Castle Kwirks.
Before the school showed up here, this place was almost empty. The fires were all out. It was dark and creepy and Drats ran around everywhere.
There were no apples!
If you don't return all the things you've found around the castle, then the Headmaster will shut down the Disbarred Bards class.
If you don't return the Headmaster's hat, then he might shut down the entire school.
Nooooo! He can't do that! You don't know what it was like before the school came here. It was all dark and creepy. Drats prowled in the halls. Nasty things slithered in the walls.
There were no apples!
If you don't agree to return all the stuff you've stolen, you'll be stuck there forever. I'll tell everyone and people will come and laugh at you.
The Headmaster will personally lecture you about stealing his hat.
The Headmaster! A Lecture! Nooooo...
You just going to sit around and do nothing?
Okay, so say I agree to bring back the stuff I found around here... you'll set me free now, okay?
Sure, it's a deal. I'll be happy to set you free. Then I'll let everyone know that you were just borrowing what you needed and that you really aren't a thief.
I'll set you loose, but you have to return everything... except for the apples. You can keep what's left of the apples.
I can keep the apples? Yes!
Of course, there aren't many apples left from the barrel I borrowed.
Yeah, right. So when I set you free, you'll just run off... You have no intention of keep the deal, do you?
Maybe.

Just remember this - if you don't bring everything you stole back to where it belongs, I'll make sure that we Kwirk-proof this school. There'll be sticky traps everywhere. You'll never get another apple again.
No apples!?!
Okay, you're the boss. Stuff comes back, all of it.
You'll set me free, pretty please? Pleeeaaaasse?
Soooo... about those apples... After I put stuff back where I found it, will you leave me an apple here by the Fireplace? That way, I won't be tempted to go borrowing again.
We'll see... after you return everything.
Okey dokey, boss, a deal's a deal. Just let me go, and I'll put things back.
But please, leave me an apple or two here every so often so I don't pine away, okay? You'll be my best friend forever!
Maybe we'll even meet here again some night, if I get enough apples.

nodes.name: Kwirk's the Jerk
nodes.description:
I caught a Kwirk in my Gooey trap tonight. He agreed to return everything. He'd like me to leave him an apple by the fireplace in the Hall of Heroes. We'll see if he lives up to his part of the bargain.

The best part is - I caught the School Thief! Hey, look at me, I can actually be a hero.

nodes.text: Ay, yie, yie! Ouchie.
Where'd this come from? Who put this here?
Here, let me help you. I'll have you out in a jiffy.
So you're the dirty son of a Drat that set this trap! Whatcha trying to do, kill me?
I'm sorry, I was trying to catch a thief who was stealing things from around the school. I didn't mean to hurt you.
I'm no thief! Sure, I may have borrowed a few things from around the castle... I'm a Finder, that's what I do. I find stuff and put it to good use.
So you're the thief who's been stealing all the things from around the castle? Looks like I caught you in the act.
What? Who you calling a thief? I didn't steal nothing.
Oh, sure, I may have borrowed a few things from here and there. I'm a Finder. It's what Finders do. We find stuff and give it a good home.
Didn't anyone ever teach you the most important Rule for Rogues? - Don't get caught!
Whatcha trying to do here, maim me for life? Do you know what they call a one-legged Kwirk? - A dust mop.
Guess you didn't hear the other important safety tip - Crime doesn't Pay. Seems like it's pretty costly for you.
I'm no thief. I'm a Finder. I find stuff. It's my job.
Urgh. How do I get this thing off me? Ow! Not that way.
What do I do? I can't run. I can't even crawl away. I'll just shrivel up here into a cheap blue toupee. <sniff>
I could gnaw my own leg off... Yeah, right.
They'll call me Pegleg and banish me from the castle to go live with the Prates on a ship. I'll be wet and seasick for the rest of my life.
Oh, woe, what a way to go!
Yikes! What? You there... hiding in the shadow. You think this is funny?
So, are you just going to lie there on your butt while I suffer in extreme agony? I could use a hand to get free of this trap.

options.text: Make a Deal with the Kwirk

nodes.text: I'll be happy to set you free... but first, you'll have to agree to return all the things you borrowed from around the school.
Look, it's really important that you get the stuff back. The Headmaster has threatened to kick us all out of the school if his hat isn't returned and the thieving stops.
Shut down the school? Nooooo!

options.text: Convince the Kwirk to Return Stuff

nodes.text: Before I set you loose from that trap, you'll have to agree to bring back all the stuff you stole from the school.
I can't do that. We're putting the stuff to good use. I'll lose my Finder title.
Well then, I guess I'll just have to leave you in that trap while I bring the Headmaster here to see who really stole his hat.
The Headmaster? He's the reason we Kwirks had to go into hiding! This castle was ours before the school started up here.
So, would you rather make a deal, or do I have to bring the Headmaster to lecture you?
No, please, not that!
<claps hands> There, I gave you a hand.
Oh, a wise guy, eh? Making jokes while I suffer unbearable agony...
So here's the deal, if you want me to free you, you have to agree to give back everything you borrowed from the school.
Everything?
You can keep the apples. From the rate I've found cores lying around, there can't be many apples left.
<sigh> I suppose... If I get to keep the apples.
Come on, pal. Give me a break. I wasn't hurting anyone. I was just finding worthless stuff lying around and putting it all to good use with us Kwirks.
Could you please set me free? Pretty please with applesauce on it?
Look, you got me over an apple barrel. I'll make a deal with you. You set me free, and I'll bring back all the stuff I found around here.
I give in. Sure, everything I borrowed comes back. Just get me out of this trap.
You'd better keep our deal, or there will be traps set for you everywhere in the castle.
You have my word of honor. You're the boss.

nodes.name: Caught the Kwirk
nodes.description:
I caught a Kwirk in my Drat trap tonight. He agreed to return everything. We'll see if he lives up to his part of the bargain.

The best part is - I caught the School Thief! Hey, look at me, I can actually be a hero.
